channel.title: Talks on Stephen Finucane (Fin-oo-can)
channel.description: Recent content in Talks on Stephen Finucane (Fin-oo-can)
channel.copyright: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0 International License.

item.title: Trading Flexibility for Performance: The HPC Story in OpenStack
item.description: This lightning talk was presented at OpenStack Days CERN in May 2019. It gave an overview of the state of the art for HPC and NFV in the OpenStack Compute.

item.title: Working With Documentation, The Openstack Way
item.description: This talk was co-presented with Alex Settle at the Denver OpenStack Summit in April 2019. It serves as a brief history of documentation within OpenStack along with a how-to on contributing to documentation today.

item.title: Will Somebody *Please* Tell Me What Is Going On?
item.description: This was a talk I gave at the inaugural PyCon Limerick in March 2019. I explored some tools available within the Python ecosystem that can be used to manage change.

item.title: Who Needs pandoc When You Have Sphinx?
item.description: This was a talk I gave at FOSDEM 2019. In this talk, subtitled “An exploration of the parsers and builders of the Sphinx documentation tool”, I explored some of the less well known aspects of both Sphinx and docutils.

item.title: How to Double* the Performance of vSwitch-based Deployments
item.description: This was a talk I have at the OpenStack Summit Berlin in November 2018. In this talk, I discussed the NUMA-aware vSwitches feature recently added to OpenStack Nova, explaining what it was, why you’d want it and how you could use it.

item.title: The Wonders of NUMA
item.description: This talk was presented at the OpenStack Summit in Vancouver in May 2018. It provided an in-depth summary of what NUMA is and why it matters so much for high-performance workloads.

item.title: A Lion, A Head, and A Dash of YAML
item.description: This talk, delivered at FOSDEM 2018, provided a quick dive into the somewhat complicated world of Sphinx extensions. Sphinx is an incredibly powerful tool but, surprisingly for a documentation, suffers from poor quality documentation.

item.title: Keeping It Real(Time)
item.description: This talk was an expanded version of the talk I had given previously at the Sydney OpenStack Summit and, as then, I once again discussed the real-time capabilities of OpenStack Nova.

item.title: Keeping It Real(Time)
item.description: Update: An expanded version of this talk was delivered at FOSDEM 2018 and is well worth the read if you’re interested in this. This talk was given as a lightning talk at the OpenStack Summit in Sydney in November 2017.

item.title: Mailing List, Meet CI
item.description: This talk was presented as a lightning talk at FOSDEM 2017. It described the CI features provided in Patchwork 2.0, which was at the time unreleased.

item.title: A New Patchwork
item.description: This was my first ever presentation to an audience that wasn’t entirely my colleagues or fellow students. It was delivered as a lightning talk at FOSDEM 2016 and focused on the work that had been done to bring Patchwork up-to-date, after it had languished for a couple of years.
